mdRecord.dcterms:description: Built for John Eyerman, a faculty lecturer in mineralogy from 1888-91. It was bought by Lafayette [College] Trustee Francis G. McKelvy and donated to College by his heirs in 1960. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lafayette_College [work]

McKelvy House is home to the prestigious College Scholars Society, a group of students nominated by the faculty to participate in a common social and intellectual experience. The students live at McKelvy House and, with the aid of a faculty advisor, organize weekly discussions on topics of common interest. -- https://sites.lafayette.edu/buildings/lafayette-college-architecture-essay/mckelvy-house/#:~:text=McKelvy%20House%2C%20originally%20the%20John,college's%20finest%20pieces%20of%20architecture. [work]
